definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: You sent us to Washington to do the tough things.
sentences.chinese: 你们选择我们到华盛顿来解决难事，做正事。

sentences.english: President Obama will get down to business soon after his arrival in Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马总统一经抵达莫斯科后将会专注于正事。

sentences.english: Then they got down to business.
There, they like to talk about business first and chat later — if there's time.
sentences.chinese: 这两个国家的人喜欢先谈正事，有时间的话再聊天。

sentences.english: Debbie greeted her cheerfully,and they got down to business.
sentences.chinese: 黛比愉快的跟她打了个招呼，便开始谈正事了。

sentences.english: With that plumbing defined, I can get down to business.
sentences.chinese: 定义了该管道之后，我就可以开始正事了。

sentences.english: It’s time we addressed ourselves to the business in hand.
sentences.chinese: 该是我们着手处理手头正事的时候了。

sentences.english: Focus on the real issue and take steps to remedy it.
sentences.chinese: 将注意力集中到正事上并且采取措施去弥补。

sentences.english: You’re already naked, why not get down to business?
sentences.chinese: 你已经准备脱衣服了，为什么不干点正事呢？

sentences.english: Let's go down to business first.
I’m a big fan of doing nothing, of solitude and relaxing and playing.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢不做正事，一个人呆着，休息或者玩这玩那。

sentences.english: Last Saturday was my first official class in Music Forest Ocean Butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 我已经正事在海蝶音乐教了舞蹈的第一堂课。

sentences.english: It's high time we stopped arguing and got down to business.
sentences.chinese: 是停止争论开始干正事的时候了。

sentences.english: The point is, you were using this company's computers unprofessionally.
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，你没在用公司的电脑干正事。

sentences.english: We avoided wrangles and got down to business.
sentences.chinese: 他们避免了争吵开始做正事。

definition: to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
casual conversation/chat/gossip/to talk about (whatever comes to mind)
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
